free_text.Form of examination: Group presentation of the project's pre-study, written report of the project. An oral exam will concern the theory and its application to industrial cases, as well as on the project.

Spinnler, Conception des machines: Principes et applications (Volume 1-4) PPUR; F. Pruvot, Conception et calcul des machines-outils (Volumes 1-3), PPUR
free_text.Required prior knowledge: [li]Master experimental and numerical analysis tools, CP2[br/][li]List the functions of an existing or new product based on the specifications, CP4 (Conception mécanique)[br/][li]Choose material and the relative treatments based on its use, performance and compatibility with the manufacturing process of the final product, CP13 (Méthodes et procédés de fabrication)[br/][li]Identify the class, the constitutive elements and the performances of a machine or a mechanical system, CP15 (Conception mécanique, Systèmes mécaniques)[br/][li]Effets dynamiques en conception/Méthodes de conception II, Mécanique vibratoire, Heat and mass transfer, Modélisation et simulation par éléments finis
free_text.Content: Integrated mechanical design method : priorization of design themes (kinematics, statics, dynamics, thermics, fatigue, mechatronics, multi-physics...). Design criteria in the following themes : modal dynamics, thermo-mechanics, fatigue, mechatronics. Solutions optimization under these criteria. Technological elements : rolling elements bearings, contactless bearings, flexible guidings. Examples : sports technical components, medical devices, vehicles, devices for ultrasonic micro-machining and assistance, very high speed spindles, sensors. Industrial case studies in these fields. Industrial type mini-project.
free_text.Keywords: Mechanical design, modal dynamics, thermomechanics, fatigue.
free_text.Type of teaching: The course is organised as theoretical sessions including industrial cases presentations, test cases as individual exercises, and the resolution of a real case study to be realised in a team project.
